meanings.definition: To lead or direct in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent1: The faulty map may misguide hikers in the forest.
meanings.sent2: Please do not misguide others with incorrect information.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to misguide the lost tourists for fun.
meanings.sent4: His deceptive smile could misguide even the most cautious individuals.
meanings.sent5: The flickering signpost seemed to misguide travelers on purpose.

meanings.definition: To give wrong directions or instructions to.
meanings.sent1: The prankster decided to misguide his friends with fake road signs.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to misguide new employees during training.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to misguide the dog with a fake scent trail.
meanings.sent4: Her unclear explanation only served to misguide the confused students further.
meanings.sent5: The faulty GPS device continued to misguide the driver down dead-end streets.

meanings.sent1: The bright lights of the city can misguide migrating birds at night.
meanings.sent2: Parents warn their children not to misguide by peer pressure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fox tried to misguide the hunting dogs away from its den.
meanings.sent4: The mirage in the desert can misguide thirsty travelers looking for water.
meanings.sent5: The false promises of the con artist aim to misguide vulnerable individuals.
